Replace.Text: +25% combat experience for all melee and ranged land units trained in this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May not be built in an Encampment district that already has a Stable.[NEWLINE]When creating an emergency Recruitment Centre, two units can be drafted from the city (depending of the available equipment, materiel and personnel).

May create tile improvements or remove features like Woods or Rainforest to harvest their resources. Builders can be used 3 times, when used to place an improvement, a part of the civilian population of the Builder is transferred to on the improvement's tile population. They passively collect resources on the tile they are at the end of their turn and will sell them to their linked city.
Unlocks the ability to construct a Wodden Fort.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Occupying unit receives +2 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength, and automatically gains 1 turns of fortification.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct the Great Wall.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides an increase to [ICON_Strength] Defense. Bonus to [ICON_Gold] Gold if adjacent to other segments. Additional [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism as you advance through the Technology Tree for adjacent segments. Must be built in a line along the borders of your empire.
Reduces the administrative cost of territory by 50%.
Double Loots from pillaging Improvements and cleaning Barbarian Camps.
+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold in the [ICON_Capital] Capital.
Unit maintenance reduced by 1 [ICON_Gold][ICON_Turn].[NEWLINE]+5% Army Size[NEWLINE]Drafted units are 1 level higher.
+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward Medieval and Renaissance era melee, anti-cavalry, and ranged units.[NEWLINE]+6% Army Size
+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward Industrial and Modern era melee, anti-cavalry, and ranged units.[NEWLINE]+7% Army Size
Unit maintenance reduced by 2 [ICON_Gold][ICON_Turn].[NEWLINE]+8% Army Size[NEWLINE]Drafted units are 1 level higher.
+100% [ICON_Production] Production for Modern, Atomic, and Information era support units.[NEWLINE]+10% Army Size
+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward Ancient and Classical era heavy and light cavalry units.[NEWLINE]+3[ICON_Turn] for drafted units
+50% [ICON_Production] Production for Modern, Atomic, and Information era heavy and light cavalry units.[NEWLINE]+6[ICON_Turn] for drafted units
Grants flanking and support combat bonuses to all combat units.[NEWLINE]Unlock Military Organization Level 1
Grants the ability to construct an additional Spy. Allows one new Casus Belli that can be used to justify wars: Colonial War.
Allows formation of Defensive Pacts. Allows one new Casus Belli that can be used to justify wars: War of Territorial Expansion.[NEWLINE]Unlock Military Organization Level 6
Allows for the transport of land units between Aerodrome districts that contain Airports.[NEWLINE]Unlock Military Organization Level 8
Allows Builders to embark.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Range] Sea Exploitation Range
All naval and embarked units can navigate Ocean tiles.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Range] Sea Exploitation Range
+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement for embarked units.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Range] Sea Exploitation Range
Allows Traders to embark.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Range] Sea Exploitation Range
Your military is organized on smaller entities requiring 20% less personnel and supplies.[NEWLINE]Units [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength is reduced but they heal faster.
+ X% [ICON_Gold] income per City, where "X" is twice the percentage of the Upper Class Population in that city.
+ X% [ICON_Gold] income per City, where "X" is the percentage of the Middle Class Population in that city.
+100% [ICON_Gold] income from taxes on imported resources, but 30% less resources imported.
Press to restart the game using the same settings
Show routes for cumulated population migration since the beginning.
Show previous turn population migration routes
The value of your Debt[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Repayment is taken from your net income.[NEWLINE]A large debt may lower your Empire stability.

Available Base Logistic = {1_Num} Personnel in cities[NEWLINE]Active Duty logistic = {2_Num} Personnel required for units support[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If the available logistic fall under the Logistic Cost of a Promotion Class, you won't be able to build new units of that class.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The logistic cost of an unit is determined by its current stock of equipment in Frontline and Reserve.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Different equipment types can have very different logistic cost.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Some buildings (like Barracks) allows you to raise the maximum number of personnel in reserve in your cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Some specialized classes require specific support, the available personnel is then lower than the Base Logistic.
{1_Name} units require {2_Name} Support, {3_Num : number #,###} available for that class

Total population = {1_Num : number #,###}[NEWLINE]Active Duty = {2_Num : number #,###} personnel ({7_Num : number #,###} in logistic + {6_Num : number #,###} in units)[NEWLINE]{3_Num : number #.##} % of population in service[NEWLINE]Conscription Efficiency = {4_Num : number #.##} %[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Conscription Efficiency goes down when the number of your Personnel in Active Duty get closer to the maximum percentage of population in service (currently {5_Num : number #.##} %).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It affects the number of personnel drafted each turn in your cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Some Policies allow you to raise a bigger army, and being at war give a boost to the percentage of population that can be drafted, until the end of the war.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The personnel in units and the personnel required to provide support to those units are considered in Active Duty.

Empire Administrative Efficiency = {1_Num : number #,###}%[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Empire Administrative cost = {2_Num : number #,###}[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Population cost = {3_Num : number #,###} from {4_Num : number #,###} pop.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Territory cost = {5_Num : number #.##} from managing {6_Num : number #,###}km²[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Cities Factor = {7_Num : number #.##} from number of cities[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Units Factor = {8_Num : number #.##} from number of units[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Development Factor = {9_Num : number #.##} from technological advancement.

Empire Administrative support = {1_Num : number #,###}[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Administrative Tablets, Scrolls, Books = {2_Num : number #,###}[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Administrative Buildings = {3_Num : number #,###}

{1_Turns : plural 1?{1_Turns} turn; other? {1_Turn} turns;} to complete when at 100% production efficiency.
A Harbor is required to work the Sea Resources in the City Range.

Only the last Employer can renew a Mercenary Contract.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Farms.[NEWLINE]Can only be built on Grassland or Plains.[NEWLINE]Constructing farms adjacent to other Farms provides bonuses to Housing.
Fishing Boats are automatically exploiting Sea Resources in the City range (require a Harbor).
